Notes: No direct ontology path for a technical row identifier; treat 'row_id' as an internal identifier for the dataset rather than an RDF-mapped property. If an identifier is needed in RDF, generate a local URI or blank node using this value.
The patient identifier maps directly to the Measurement's link to a Patient via 'AIDAVA:hasPatient'. No 2-hop path exists from AIDAVA:Patient, so this 1-hop path is optimal.

Measurement codes are best mapped via 'sphn:hasCode' to a Code entity. A 2-hop alternative exists via Terminology (path 5), but unless the dataset includes terminology metadata, direct mapping to Code is more precise.
Quantitative measurement values are represented as Quantity in the ontology. No 2-hop path from Quantity is available, so direct mapping is semantically optimal.

Measurement units are attributes of the Quantity entity. Since the ontology links to Quantity, and units are typically modeled as a property of Quantity, this is the most appropriate path; no 2-hop path offers a superior mapping.
'measurement_date' is best mapped to 'hasMeasurementDateTime' which links to an xsd:dateTime. There is no more specific 2-hop path from dateTime, so this is optimal.
